meanings.definition: The quality of a gemstone exhibiting a changeable luster or color when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent1: The chatoyance of the gemstone made it sparkle differently as I turned it in the light.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler explained that the chatoyance of the stone was what made it so unique.
meanings.sent3: The chatoyance of the gemstone seemed to play hide and seek with the light, creating a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a chatoyance that seemed to reveal different emotions with each glance.
meanings.sent5: The chatoyance of the gemstone was like a secret waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of a material appearing to have a cat's eye effect when light is reflected off its surface.
meanings.sent1: The chatoyance of the fabric gave it a mysterious glow under the spotlight.
meanings.sent2: The chatoyance of the marble made it look like a cat's eye staring back at me.
meanings.sent3: The chatoyance of the material made it seem like it had a mischievous personality of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a chatoyance that made it stand out like a star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The chatoyance of the fabric was so enchanting, it felt like magic woven into threads.
